thread.title: New 'son of Concorde' would fly London - New York in an hour
thread.title_full: New 'son of Concorde' would fly London - New York in an hour

title: New 'son of Concorde' would fly London - New York in an hour
text:
Airbus has filed patents for a new supersonic jet dubbed the “son of Concorde”, which would see it fly from London to New York in an hour. 
The jet would reportedly be able to reach four times the speed of sound - some 2,500 mph. 
It means a flight from London to New York would take the same as a train journey from London to Brighton. 
The European company Airbus has said the new aircraft would be largely for “business travel and VIP passengers who require transcontinental return journeys within one day”, Sky News reported. 
It also said the military could use it for strategic reconnaissance as well as “ultra-rapid transport of high added-value goods or elite commandos”. 
Documents that have been lodged with the US Patent Office have described Concorde mark 2 as an “ultra-rapid air vehicle”. 
According to reports, it would take off almost vertically, similar to a space shuttle, cruising at more than 100,000 feet, and carrying 20 passengers for distances of up to 5,500 miles. 
It would then re-enter normal air space as it approached its destination before landing. 
The original Concorde flew at more than twice the speed of sound, at 1,350mph – an altitude of 60,000 feet, carrying up to 120 passengers. 
It was withdrawn from service in 2003 after a crash in Paris three years earlier.
